briefdescription.para: Successful status code returned by I2C API.
Generic error status code returned by I2C API.
Timeout status code returned by I2C API.
An error status code returned by I2C_control() for undefined command codes.
Wait forever define used to specify timeouts.

detaileddescription.para: In I2C_MODE_BLOCKING, calls to I2C_transfer() block until the I2C_Transaction completes. Other threads calling I2C_transfer() while a transaction is in progress are also placed into a blocked state. If multiple threads are blocked, the thread with the highest priority will be unblocked first. This implies that arbitration will not be executed in chronological order.

simplesect.para: When using I2C_MODE_BLOCKING, I2C_transfer() must be called from a thread context.

detaileddescription.para: In I2C_MODE_CALLBACK, calls to I2C_transfer() return immediately. The application's callback function, I2C_Params.transferCallbackFxn, is called when the transaction is complete. Sequential calls to I2C_transfer() will place I2C_Transaction structures into an internal queue. Queued transactions are automatically started after the previous transaction has completed. This queuing occurs regardless of any error state from previous transactions. The transactions are always executed in chronological order. The I2C_Params.transferCallbackFxn function will be called asynchronously as each transaction is completed.

briefdescription.para: Return behavior of I2C_Transfer() specified in the I2C_Params.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration defines the return behaviors for a call to I2C_transfer().
I2C Standard-mode. Up to 100 kbit/s.
I2C Fast-mode. Up to 400 kbit/s.
I2C Fast-mode Plus. Up to 1Mbit/s.
I2C High-speed mode. Up to 3.4Mbit/s.
I2C High-speed mode. Up to 3.4Mbit/s.

briefdescription.para: Bit rate for an I2C driver instance specified in the I2C_Params.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration defines the bit rates used with an I2C_transfer().

simplesect.para: You must check that the device specific implementation supports the desired I2C_BitRate.

briefdescription.para: A handle that is returned from an I2C_open() call.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* I2C_CallbackFxn) (I2C_Handle handle, I2C_Transaction *transaction, bool transferStatus)
memberdef.name: I2C_CallbackFxn

briefdescription.para: The definition of a callback function.

detaileddescription.para: When operating in I2C_MODE_CALLBACK, the callback function is called when an I2C_transfer() completes. The application is responsible for declaring an I2C_CallbackFxn function and providing a pointer in I2C_Params.transferCallbackFxn.

simplesect.para: The callback function is called from an interrupt context.

parameterdescription.para: I2C_Handle used with the initial call to I2C_transfer()
Pointer to the I2C_Transaction structure used with the initial call to I2C_transfer(). This structure also contains the custom argument specified by transaction.arg.
Boolean indicating if the I2C transaction was successful. If true, the transaction was successful. If false, the transaction failed.

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver-specific implementation of I2C_cancel().
A function pointer to a driver-specific implementation of I2C_close().

memberdef.definition: typedef int_fast16_t(* I2C_ControlFxn) (I2C_Handle handle, uint_fast16_t cmd, void *controlArg)
memberdef.name: I2C_ControlFxn

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver-specific implementation of I2C_control().
A function pointer to a driver-specific implementation of I2C_init().
A function pointer to a driver-specific implementation of I2C_open().

memberdef.definition: typedef int_fast16_t(* I2C_TransferFxn) (I2C_Handle handle, I2C_Transaction *transaction, uint32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: I2C_TransferFxn

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver-specific implementation of I2C_transfer().
I2C driver's custom configuration structure.
Cancels all I2C transfers.

detaileddescription.para: This function will cancel asynchronous I2C_transfer() operations, and is applicable only for I2C_MODE_CALLBACK mode. The in progress transfer, as well as any queued transfers, will be canceled. The individual callback functions for each transfer will be called in chronological order. The callback functions are called in the same context as the I2C_cancel().

simplesect.para: I2C_Transfer() has been called.

Different I2C slave devices will behave differently when an in-progress transfer fails and needs to be canceled. The slave may need to be reset, or there may be other slave-specific steps that can be used to successfully resume communication.

briefdescription.para: Function to close an I2C driver instance.

simplesect.para: I2C_open() has been called.

briefdescription.para: Function performs implementation specific features on a driver instance.

simplesect.para: I2C_open() has to be called first.

parameterdescription.para: A command value defined by the device specific implementation
An optional R/W (read/write) argument that is accompanied with cmd

simplesect.para: Implementation specific return codes. Negative values indicate unsuccessful operations.

parameterdescription.para: The cmd value is not supported by the device specific implementation.

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize the I2C driver.

detaileddescription.para: This function must also be called before any otherI2C driver APIs.

briefdescription.para: Open an I2C driver instance.

simplesect.para: I2C_init() has been called.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to an initialized I2C_Params structure. If NULL, the default I2C_Params values are used.

simplesect.para: An I2C_Handle on success, or NULL on an error.

briefdescription.para: Initialize an I2C_Params structure to its default values.

detaileddescription.para:
params
A pointer to I2C_Params structure for initialization.
Defaults values are:
I2C_Params.transferMode = I2C_MODE_BLOCKING
I2C_Params.transferCallbackFxn = NULL
I2C_Params.bitRate = I2C_100kHz
I2C_Params.custom = NULL

briefdescription.para: Perform an I2C transaction with an I2C slave peripheral.

detaileddescription.para: This function will perform an I2C transfer, as specified by an I2C_Transaction structure.

simplesect.para: When using I2C_MODE_BLOCKING, this must be called from a thread context.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an I2C_Transaction. The application is responsible for allocating and initializing an I2C_Transaction structure prior to passing it to I2C_Transfer(). This structure must persist in memory unmodified until the transfer is complete.

simplesect.para: I2C_Transaction structures cannot be re-used until the previous transaction has completed.
In I2C_MODE_BLOCKING: true for a successful transfer; false for an error (for example, an I2C bus fault (NACK)).
In I2C_MODE_CALLBACK: always true. The I2C_CallbackFxn bool argument will be true to indicate success, and false to indicate an error.
I2C_open() has been called.

briefdescription.para: Perform an I2C transaction with an I2C slave peripheral.

detaileddescription.para: This function will perform an I2C transfer, as specified by an I2C_Transaction structure. If timeout is exceeded, then the transaction will come to a halt.

simplesect.para: When using I2C_MODE_BLOCKING, this must be called from a thread context.
The timeout restriction is only applied when using I2C_MODE_BLOCKING.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an I2C_Transaction. The application is responsible for allocating and initializing an I2C_Transaction structure prior to passing it to I2C_TransferTimeout(). This structure must persist in memory unmodified until the transfer is complete.

The time in system ticks to wait for the transaction to complete. Passing I2C_WAIT_FOREVER into this parameter will cause I2C_transferTimeout() to behave the same as I2C_transfer() but with a more detailed return status

simplesect.para: I2C_Transaction structures cannot be re-used until the previous transaction has completed.
In I2C_MODE_BLOCKING: I2C_STATUS_SUCCESS for a successful transfer; I2C_STATUS_ERROR for an error (for example, an I2C bus fault (NACK)); I2C_STATUS_TIMEOUT for a timeout
In I2C_MODE_CALLBACK: always I2C_STATUS_SUCCESS. The I2C_CallbackFxn transferStatus argument will be true to indicate success, and false to indicate an error.
I2C_open() has been called.

briefdescription.para: Inter-Integrated Circuit (I2C) Driver.

detaileddescription.para: The I2C driver is designed to operate as an I2C master and will not function as an I2C slave. Multi-master arbitration is not supported; therefore, this driver assumes it is the only I2C master on the bus. This I2C driver's API set provides the ability to transmit and receive data over an I2C bus between the I2C master and I2C slave(s). The application is responsible for manipulating and interpreting the data.
This section provides a basic usage summary and a set of examples in the form of commented code fragments. Detailed descriptions of the I2C APIs and their effect are provided in subsequent sections.

para.ref: Writing then reading in a single transaction

detaileddescription.para: After calling I2C_init(), the application can open an I2C instance by calling I2C_open().The following code example opens an I2C instance with default parameters by passing NULL for the I2C_Params argument.

para.heading: Writing two bytes and reading four bytes in a single transaction.

detaileddescription.para: This final example shows usage of I2C_MODE_CALLBACK, with queuing of multiple transactions. Because multiple transactions are simultaneously queued, separate I2C_Transaction structures must be used. Each I2C_Transaction will contain a custom application argument of a semaphore handle. The I2C_Transaction.arg will point to the semaphore handle. When the callback function is called, the I2C_Transaction.arg is checked for NULL. If this value is not NULL, then it can be assumed the arg is pointing to a valid semaphore handle. The semaphore handle is then used to call sem_post(). Hypothetically, this can be used to signal transaction completion to the task(s) that queued the transaction(s).

Snippets of the thread code that initiates the transactions are shown below. Note the use of multiple I2C_Transaction structures. The handle of the semaphore to be posted is specified via i2cTransaction2.arg. I2C_transfer() is called three times to initiate each transaction. Since callback mode is used, these functions return immediately. After the transactions have been queued, other work can be done. Eventually, sem_wait() is called causing the thread to block until the transaction completes. When the transaction completes, the application's callback function, callbackFxn will be called. Once I2C_CallbackFxn posts the semaphore, the thread will be unblocked and can resume execution.
Refer to the Driver's Configuration section for driver configuration information.
